gui.reports.common
Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  gui.reports.common.Grid

public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object

The Grid is a table of strings. It can be constructed by passing in a list of header strings. This will establish the number of columns in a table. New rows can be added by passing a list of strings to newRow().

Constructor Summary
Grid()
          Construct an emptry grid.
Grid(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headers)
          Construct a grid with the same number of columns as there are entries in the list passed in.
 
Method Summary
 void addRow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> stringList)
          Adds a copy of the passed in list of strings to the list of rows.
 void clearAndSetColumns(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headers)
          Clears all data from the table and resets column count, and header titles.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Grid

public Grid()
Construct an emptry grid. Warning, clearAndSetColumns must be called before calling newRow if this constructor is used.

Grid

public Grid(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headers)
Construct a grid with the same number of columns as there are entries in the list passed in. These entries will be set as the column headers.

Method Detail

clearAndSetColumns

public void clearAndSetColumns(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> headers)
Clears all data from the table and resets column count, and header titles.

addRow

public void addRow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> stringList)
Adds a copy of the passed in list of strings to the list of rows. If the number of entries in the row exceeds the number of columns in the table an exception is thrown.
